org.ow2.proactive.resourcemanager

Class RMFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ow2.proactive.resourcemanager.RMFactory

  • @PublicAPI
public class RMFactory
extends Object
    Object which performs the Resource Manager (RM) creation, and provides RM's front-end active objects:
    • RMAuthentication
    • RMMonitoring
    • RMProxyUserInterface
    Since:
    ProActive Scheduling 0.9

    • Constructor Detail

        public RMFactory()

    • Method Detail

      • startLocal

        public static RMAuthentication startLocal(RMInitializer initializer)
                                   throws Exception
        Creates and starts a Resource manager on the local host using the given initializer to configure it. Only one RM can be started by JVM.
        Parameters:
        initializer - Use to configure the Resource Manager before starting it. This parameter can be null, if so the Resource Manager will try to start on the JVM properties and the "pa.rm.home" property MUST be set to the root of the RM directory.
        Returns:
        a RM authentication that allow you to administer the RM or get its connection URL.
        Throws:
        org.objectweb.proactive.core.node.NodeException - If the RM's node can't be created
        org.objectweb.proactive.ActiveObjectCreationException - If RMCore cannot be created
        AlreadyBoundException - if a node with the same RMNode's name is already exist.
        IOException - If node and RMCore fails.
        RMException - if the connection to the authentication interface fails.
        Exception

      • configureJSch

        public static void configureJSch()

      • startLocal

        public static RMAuthentication startLocal()
                                   throws Exception
        Creates and starts a Resource manager on the local host. This call considered that the JVM is correctly configured for starting RM. The "pa.rm.home" and required JVM properties MUST be set.
        Returns:
        a RM authentication that allow you to administer the RM or get its connection URL.
        Throws:
        org.objectweb.proactive.core.node.NodeException - If the RM's node can't be created
        org.objectweb.proactive.ActiveObjectCreationException - If RMCore cannot be created
        AlreadyBoundException - if a node with the same RMNode's name is already exist.
        IOException - If node and RMCore fails.
        Exception

      • setOsJavaProperty

        public static void setOsJavaProperty()
        Set Java Property "os" used by default GCM deployment file.
